class Solution:
    def minChanges(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> int:
        n = len(nums)
        c = Counter()
        d = Counter()
        x, mx = 0, 0
        for i in range(n // 2):
            c[abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i])] += 1
            d[min(min(nums[i], k-nums[i]),min(nums[n-1-i],k-nums[n-1-i]))] += 1
            # if c[abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i])] > mx:
            #     mx = c[abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i])]
            #     x = abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i])
            # elif c[abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i])] == mx and abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i]) < x:
            #     x = abs(nums[i] - nums[n-1-i])
        # print(d)
        nd = [0] * (k+3)
        for i in range(k,-1,-1):
            nd[i] = d[i]
            nd[i] += nd[i+1]
        ret = n * 2
        for u,v in sorted([(-u, v) for u,v in c.items()]):
            t = nd[k + u + 1]
            # print(-u, v, t, n//2-v+t)
            ret = min(ret, n//2 - v + t)
        return ret

        #         continue
        #     if nums[i] + x > k and nums[n-1-i] + x > k and nums[i] - x < 0 and nums[n-1-i] - x < 0:
        #         ret += 2

        #         ret += 1
        # return ret
